text: Has anyone encounter the issue of using the HubSpot Tracking API but your code base is preventing you to make async/await in your code-behind? If so did anyone found a work around. I tried using Task but they i get a complaint to update my framework to 4.5 but my codebase is using 4.5.2

Hey everyone! <@UD53A9UUR> <@U01QVR44MEY> It seems like were having another OAuth issue. You can use the same <https://app.HubSpot.com/oauth/authorize?client_id=cdfcf3a5-6702-4135-b040-d46245f807bc&redirect_uri=https%3A%2F%2Foauthdebugger.com%2Fdebug&scope=crm.schemas.contacts.read&response_type=code&response_mode=form_post&state=ipyz3vbduxs&nonce=2jh8wclw975|link> as last time to test. Open in a new private browser window so you arenâ€™t logged in and get to the create or sign in screen. When you sign in eventually you get an invalid scope error. Now that you are logged in, you can go to the link, try again, and everything works like normal.

The callback urls change depending on how you log in:

<https://www.diffchecker.com/DevQEw0A/>

It seems to add `&optional_scope=null` causing an issue. It also removes the nonce again.
Hello, Did you find any solution for this? Actually i am also looking for a bit same fucntionality
no still looking, i think getting a 3rd party solution is the only way
